019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc;
020
021import static java.lang.String.format;
022import static java.lang.System.arraycopy;
023import static java.lang.System.out;
024import static java.util.Objects.nonNull;
025import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.SOURCE_PATH;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.determineElementName;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.OtherFileTagletBase.ProcessMode.DEFAULT;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.EMPTY_STRING;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.splitString;
033
034import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
035import java.io.File;
036import java.io.FileReader;
037import java.io.IOException;
038import java.io.Reader;
039import java.util.EnumSet;
040import java.util.List;
041
042import org.apiguardian.api.API;
043import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common;
044import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.JavadocError;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.OtherFileTagletBase;
046import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
047import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.util.Template;
048import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
049
050/**
051 *  <p>{@summary This taglet allows to include the contents of an external file
052 *  into the JavaDoc documentation.} This is particularly useful when the
053 *  contents of resource files (like a DTD or an XML Schema) should be shown in
054 *  the documentation.</p>
055 *  <p>Usually, that file is stored somewhere on the
056 *  {@link Common#SOURCE_PATH SOURCE_PATH}; this means that a file is addressed
057 *  by its path name on the source tree. For example to include this file, the
058 *  path would be
059 *  {@code org/tquadrat/foundation/javadoc/IncludeTaglet.java}.</p>
060 *  <p>But additional roots can be provided through system properties, where
061 *  the name of the new root will be prefixed by
062 *  {@value #PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX}, like
063 *  {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.resources}. To use this root,
064 *  prefix the path in the tag with {@code ${resources}}.</p>
065 *  <p>The file contents can be processed in some way before it will be
066 *  included; refer to
067 *  {@link ProcessMode}
068 *  for the details.</p>
069 *  <p>The use of this tag will look like this:</p>
070 *  <pre><code>&hellip; {&#64;include &lt;<i>filename</i>&gt;:&lt;<i>processMode</i>&gt;} &hellip;</code></pre>
071 *  <p>where the &lt;processMode&gt; can be omitted. If the given file does not
072 *  exist or is empty, nothing will be included, and no error message will be
073 *  issued.</p>
074 *  <p><b>Notes:</b></p>
075 *  <ul>
076 *      <li>If Maven is used, and the include file is not placed at the
077 *      {@code java} path (but on the {@code resources} path, for example}, it
078 *      is required to add the parameter <code>&lt;sourcepath&gt;</code> to the
079 *      configuration of the {@code maven-javadoc-plugin}, where the path of
080 *      the include file is added; otherwise, it will not be found.
081 *      Alternatively an external root can be used, as described above.</li>
082 *      <li>At default, Gradle adds only {@code *.java} files as sources for
083 *      the Javadoc task. To make other files available for the
084 *      {@code @include} tag, an external root should be used. This is
085 *      mandatory for files that are stored at the {@code resources} path.</li>
086 *      <li>In general, both Maven and Gradle may have funny ideas about the
087 *      source path, so the recommendation is to use an external root
088 *      always.</li>
089 *      <li>If the source of a class should be included, the path to the source
090 *      file is relative to the module directory, if one exists.</li>
091 *      <li>The {@code {@include}} tag is an inline tag; that means that the
092 *      contents of the included file will be seamlessly integrated into the
093 *      other text of the respective Javadoc comment.</li>
094 *  </ul>
095 *
096 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
097 *  @version $Id: IncludeTaglet.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
098 *  @since 0.0.5
099 */
100@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IncludeTaglet.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
101@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
102public class IncludeTaglet extends OtherFileTagletBase
103{
104        /*-----------*\
105    ====** Constants **========================================================
106        \*-----------*/
107    /**
108     *  The name of this taglet: {@value}.
109     */
110    public static final String TAGLET_NAME = "include";
111
112        /*--------------*\
113    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
114        \*--------------*/
115    /**
116     *  Creates a new {@code IncludeTaglet} instance.
117     */
118    @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantNoArgConstructor" )
119    public IncludeTaglet()
120    {
121        super( TAGLET_NAME, true, EnumSet.allOf( Location.class ) );
122    }   //  IncludeTaglet()
123
124        /*---------*\
125    ====** Methods **==========================================================
126        \*---------*/
127    /**
128     *  {@inheritDoc}
129     */
130    @Override
131    public final String toString( final List<? extends DocTree> tags, final Element element )
132    {
133        var retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
134
135        final var tag = tags.get( 0 ).toString().trim();
136        final var len = tag.length() - 1;
137        final var prefixLen = getName().length() + 3;
138        final var contents = tag.substring( prefixLen, len ).trim();
139
140        final var parts = splitString( contents, ':' );
141        final String fileName;
142        final ProcessMode processMode;
143        final String [] parameters;
144
145        switch( parts.length )
146        {
147            case 0 ->
148            {
149                //---* No argument for the tag *-------------------------------
150                fileName = EMPTY_STRING;
151                //noinspection AssignmentToNull
152                processMode = null;
153                //noinspection AssignmentToNull
154                parameters = null;
155            }
156            case 1 ->
157            {
158                //---* Just the file name *------------------------------------
159                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
160                processMode = DEFAULT;
161                parameters = EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
162            }
163            case 2 ->
164            {
165                //---* A file name and the process mode *----------------------
166                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
167                ProcessMode p;
168                try
169                {
170                    p = ProcessMode.valueOf( parts[1].trim() );
171                }
172                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final IllegalArgumentException e )
173                {
174                    p = DEFAULT;
175                }
176                processMode = p;
177                parameters = EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
178            }
179            default ->
180            {
181                //---* A file name and the process mode plus some parameters *-
182                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
183                ProcessMode p;
184                try
185                {
186                    p = ProcessMode.valueOf( parts[1].trim() );
187                }
188                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final IllegalArgumentException e )
189                {
190                    p = DEFAULT;
191                }
192                processMode = p;
193                final var length = parts.length - 2;
194                parameters = new String[length];
195                arraycopy( parts, 2, parameters, 0, length );
196            }
197        }
198
199        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( fileName ) )
200        {
201            if( fileName.startsWith( "/" ) )
202            {
203                //---* An absolute path based on an external root *------------
204                final var file = new File( fileName );
205                if( !file.exists() )
206                {
207                    final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
208                    out.printf( "Cannot locate the include file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
209                }
210                //noinspection OverlyBroadCatchBlock
211                try( final Reader reader = new FileReader( file ) )
212                {
213                    //noinspection ConstantConditions
214                    retValue = processMode.processFile( fileName, reader, parameters );
215                }
216                catch( final IOException e )
217                {
218                    //---* Should never happen *-------------------------------
219                    final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
220                    out.printf( "Failed to include the file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
221                }
222            }
223            else if( !fileName.startsWith( "$" ) )
224            {
225                //---* A relative path *---------------------------------------
226                try
227                {
228                    @SuppressWarnings( "resource" )
229                    final var inputFile = getEnvironment().getJavaFileManager().getFileForInput( SOURCE_PATH, EMPTY_STRING, fileName );
230                    if( nonNull( inputFile) )
231                    {
232                        //noinspection ConstantConditions
233                        retValue = processMode.processFile( inputFile, parameters );
234                    }
235                    else
236                    {
237                        final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
238                        out.printf( "Failed to include the file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
239                    }
240                }
241                catch( final IOException e )
242                {
243                    throw new JavadocError( format( "Problems getting FileObject for '%s'", fileName ), e );
244                }
245            }
246            else
247            {
248                //---* Retrieval for the root path failed *--------------------
249                final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
250                out.printf( "Failed to resolve include file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
251            }
252        }
253
254        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
255        return retValue;
256    }   //  toString()
257}
258//  class IncludeTaglet
259
260/*
261 *  End of File
262 */
